meanings.definition: The act of performing acrobatic movements on a rope.
meanings.sent1: The circus performer amazed the audience with her ropedancing skills.
meanings.sent2: Ropedancing requires a lot of strength and balance.
meanings.sent3: The ropedancing squirrel in the park entertained the children.
meanings.sent4: Her grace and agility while ropedancing were like a bird in flight.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ropedancer suspended in the air was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A form of entertainment involving balancing and dancing on a rope.
meanings.sent1: The ropedancing show at the fair was a crowd favorite.
meanings.sent2: People gasped in awe at the daring stunts of the ropedancers.
meanings.sent3: The ropedancing competition had everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The ropedancing performance was a delicate dance in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The music played softly as the ropedancers swayed gracefully above.

meanings.definition: To engage in the activity of dancing on a rope.
meanings.sent1: She ropedancing in the circus every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The children love to watch their dog ropedancing in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: He ropedancing across the tightrope, pretending to be a superhero.
meanings.sent4: The leaves ropedancing in the wind as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The flames from the campfire seemed to ropedance in the darkness.
